pr_title: [#9536] Course Join Confirmation Page E2E Tests

timeline.bodyText: This should also be WebPageURIs#JOIN_PAGE. The only difference is the entity doing the join.
timeline.author: wkurniawan07

timeline.bodyText:
At this stage, we shouldn't have dependency on StringHelper.encrypt because this method has dependency to the encryption key set in the application. We need to either:

Set up another encryption method that is configured via test.properties used by E2E tests. (not preferred)
Modify the API layer such that all keys that are returned are already encrypted. I am of the belief this is already the case for non-admin user-facing endpoints.
timeline.author: wkurniawan07

replies.bodyText: Changed to encrypting in GetInstructorsAction and GetStudentAction instead.
replies.author: jtankw3

replies.bodyText: @wkurniawan07 it seems that I have used StringHelper.encrypt to get student keys in other E2E tests. Should I change them all in another PR before/after merging this one?
replies.author: jtankw3

replies.bodyText: It's ok to change them here
replies.author: wkurniawan07

timeline.bodyText: This is not something specific to the course join page, though
timeline.author: wkurniawan07

timeline.bodyText: I'm aware that this is from previous UI test, but is this necessary? I don't think cookies are carried over to browsers initialized by Selenium.
timeline.author: wkurniawan07

replies.bodyText: I think it may be needed for testing with staging server as user info is copied from tester's browser.
replies.author: jtankw3

timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates into course-join-page-e2e
Remove unneeded expected page content in CourseJoinConfirmationPage
